title: Arrays & Pointers
subject: C Programming
theory:
Array name `arr` acts as a constant pointer to valid first element (`&arr[0]`). 
`arr[i]` is internally `*(arr + i)`.

common_mistakes.correction: Array name is CONSTant pointer. Cannot change valid. `int *p = arr; p++;` is fine.

interview_questions.question: Is arr same as &arr?
interview_questions.answer: Value is same, type is different. arr is int*, &arr is int(*)[].
